data.title: Dr. Phil's foodie Review
data.text:
Short wait, much less than the Outback only 1/2 mile away, with courteous, polite staff in all areas.  The menu is diverse for virtually anyone's appetite or food likes.. or dislikes.  If your a steak lover there's more than enough variety in terms of cuts, sizes and costs, to satisfy most everyone's appetite.  The very high fabric covered booths offer a wonderful privacy and noise reducing experience for maximal enjoyment of your fellow guests dining with you.  The servers are well trained, prompt, attentive and knowledgeable of the menu variations.

Too much food, after soup and Steak Cobb Salad to enjoy some very tempting desert offerings.

All areas clean and neat and well kept.  A more affordable venue for meat lovers than most other offerings.  We'll definitely come back to dine again.

data.title: Birthday
data.text: Great service and food! Our server was spot on in refilling our drinks and supplying more of their delicious bread! It was very crowded the night we were there with other families celebrating a birthday. Enjoy coming here.

data.title: The steak
data.text: If you are looking for an excelent steakhouse in Torrance, this is the right place. The ribs are amazing.

data.title: Great steaks ...
data.text: I visited this restaurant with my parents on a tuesday night, the food was great, we ordered a primerib which was superb and a ribeye which hard a great taste, we also had some salad and desert. Overall ir was a great dinner, the only downside was that our waitress was allways talking with other employees which made our dinner time longer that what we expected, but it is a great place to eat.

data.title: TripAdvisor Top 1% World says Best Black Angus !!!
data.text:
I have had the pleasure of eating at this Restaurant many times,
the first was when they opened years ago. It has always been a great
experience. The portions large, food quality Fresh, Steak, Seafood
Chicken, have been very wonderful. Very nice, Friendly Staff every time,
as I have never had a bad experience. Louis the Manager is upholding
the great Tradition. Check for deals on the Internet available,
so you can dine frequently. Bet you will Like this Location.

data.title: Jus' not the way to celebrate a birthday :(
data.text: Black Angus has always been our "go to" restaurant for special occasions.  The prime rib and ribs have always been tender and juicy!  This time we were disappointed with the quality and taste of the BBQ ribs and with the filet mignon sandwich.  The ribs were just not as flavorful and moist as we've had at other Black Angus' locations.  The filet mignon was a bit tough and the mayonnaise was wa-a-ay too spicy.  And, the sandwich roll was too hard for my mom to bite.  My top sirloin and my brother's prime rib were okay...not bad but nothing to write home about.  It's just that we've had GREAT food, GREAT service, and a GREAT time at other locations...  Will we eat again at a Black Angus?  Yup!...just not in Torrance...

data.title: Great food-slow experience
data.text: Black Angus is the only restaurant I know that will make you wait almost Xbox hour before you sit or eat. Mind you, the food is great, always had been, but my wife doesn't like waiting. She needs her food when she's hungry.  Seems like either people eating slow or slow staff with bussing tables. I'll go back again; just need faster sit times.

data.title: Always very good
data.text: We go about 3-4 times a year.. Always consistent. Great staff, my petite teriyaki top is always just perfect, my son and a full rack, his favorite, and my bf prime rib also perfect😆

data.title: Great Lamb!
data.text: Went to try my first Lamb and it was great! Tender and delicious! Highly recommend Black Angus for lamb! As well as other dishes. Reasonably priced and they always come with great sides as well! We'll be back soon.

data.title: Good Steaks But Tiny Lobster
data.text: The steaks are always done to perfection, but, if you get the staek and lobster it is more like "steak and prawn". The lobster tails are small and just leave you wanting a bit more.

data.title: Black Angus
data.text: Over the years we have gone to Black Angus and always left very satisfied with our meal.  Yes, I am a red meat eater and like a good steak now and then.  The price is right, food is delicious, and service is good.  Menu is easy to read and good selection. We generally eat there for dinner.  We go there for a small group for lunch...super salmon, too.  We have gone there for celebrations for b-day, anniversaries, and etc.

data.title: MUCH IMPROVED
data.text: Years ago, I began boycotting this restaurant because of its poor service. It was so bad, our meal was comped by the manager.  After persistent urging of the family, we have returned and to my surprise, the service has greatly improved. The food has always been tasty, but the improved service makes the meal even more enjoyable. Still very crowded on the weekends (even with reservations), but unless its a holiday, the wait is bearable.

data.title: Good Pork Chop
data.text: It can be difficult to get a decent pork chop these days.  They did a very good job yesterday.  Lunch is a real steal !!!

data.title: Pretty good!
data.text: I like this place, especially when you have a 2 for 1 coupon or another good incentive... Also it's a good idea to sign up for your birthday dinner!

data.title: 29th Anniversary Dinner
data.text: Went her to complete anniversary day. Stopped in bar first to have a couple of cocktails. Staff was very pleasant and attentive. Proceeded into restaurant area. Again food was top notch. had wagon wheel platter sampler for starters and new steak, baked potato, and a Caesar salad for dinner. All were well prepared. Staff attended to us quickly and effectively.

data.title: Nice sized portions!
data.text: Good tasting food, moderately priced and never a long wait to get seated. I usually get coupons in the local advertisements and I take advantage of the deals offered. There's a nice variety of food to chose from and there's a full bar at this location. I went with my family, I have a 6 year old and a 1 year old, they offer a kids menu. The portion sizes are so big, I usual have left overs or I'm too full for dessert.

data.title: Great Buger
data.text: What a great hamburger. Try this one. Couldn't tell you about the steaks or anything else I was in the mood for a hamburger I'm on the road traveling I figured any steakhouse should have a good burger.  And they did. You really won't need to eat anything else today after one of these.

data.title: Someday food is good, someday food is bad.
data.text:
Be very honest with you, someday food is good, 4 stars, but someday food is bad, 1 star.
My wife and I agree that quality of food has been slipped down past 5 ~ 7 years. Grilled Fresh Salmon used to be decent size for an adult meal. Last December 2015, it was a size for 5 years old meal. We were shocked and outraged! We gave a chance to Black Angus on April 2016, not only they made us wait for 30 minutes (Restaurant was not busy at all) to cook Salmon, but inside middle of Salmon was clearly uncooked. We called manager to complain. BBQ Baby Back Ribs: it was just OK in my opinion. Some flavor was missing. I ordered Full Rack size, it was fairly large size, but had not enough meat on it. Fire-Grilled Chicken Breasts was OK, I guess. Bleu Filet Mignon was good, according to my son. They discontinued Garlic Mashed Potatoes. It was our favorite. Fire-Grilled Fresh Artichoke was good, but got smaller and smaller. Overall, quality of food has been down graded in the past a few years. What we like Black Angus is nice private style table that you don't sit with other guests top of each other. Service is good. We would recommend this restaurant highly if you would ask us many years ago, but for now, we are not sure anymore. Because, truthfully speaking, someday food is good, but someday food is bad...really bad. Maybe, the day you go to there for Lunch or Dinner, food may be good. We wish you best of luck!!

data.title: Classic Steak house with a homey relaxing atmosphere
data.text: My wife and I go there with relatives on occasion and the LOVE MEAT. So if you hanker a good steak, large potato, etc, this s the place. Hint: for Valentines day, sit at the bar, waiting for a table takes time.  Always a pleasure to eat there.

data.title: Flip a coin
data.text: First time we went there, was great 5 stars! Second time 2 stars. Flip a coin for service either great or poor depending on kitchen or waiter. More recently food was undersized portion and undercooked. When we complained we got a better larger portion. Generally good but dont expect great service everytime.
